perturbation.original_text: This Agreement is made this 21st day of January 2003 by and between Lucent Technologies Inc., a Delaware corporation having a principal place of business at 600 Mountain Avenue, Murray Hill, New Jersey 07974 ("Lucent") and mPhase Technologies Inc., a New Jersey corporation located at 587 Connecticut Avenue, Norwalk, Connecticut 068545 ("mPhase") (each individually, "a Party" and, collectively, "the Parties"}.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement is made this 21st day of January 2003 by and between Lucent Technologies Inc., a Delaware corporation having a principal place of business at 600 Mountain Avenue, Murray Hill, New Jersey 07974 ("Lucent") and mPhase Technologies Inc., a New Jersey corporation located at 587 Connecticut Avenue, Norwalk, Connecticut 068545 ("mPhase") (each individually, "a Party" and, collectively, "the Organizations").
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Parties' to 'Organizations' creates confusion as to whether these terms are interchangeable. Later clauses referring to 'Parties' may or may not apply to both Lucent and mPhase if they are now considered 'Organizations' collectively.

perturbation.original_text: Either party wishing to terminate the Agreement must give written notice to the other party at least thirty (30) days prior to the desired date of termination.
perturbation.changed_text: Either organization wishing to terminate the Agreement must give written notice to the other entity at least thirty (30) days prior to the desired date of termination.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'party' to 'organization' and 'other party' to 'other entity', we introduce ambiguity. Are 'organization' and 'entity' meant to be synonymous with the original definition of 'Party,' or do they introduce a new, undefined meaning? This affects the legal obligations for termination.

perturbation.original_text: Neither Party shall be liable to the other for special, incidental, or consequential damages, even if such Party has been advised of the possibility of such damages.
perturbation.changed_text: Neither organization shall be liable to the other entity for special, incidental, or consequential damages, even if such person has been advised of the possibility of such damages.
perturbation.explanation: Here, 'Party' is changed to 'organization', 'other' is changed to 'entity' and 'such party' to 'such person'. The change to 'person' from 'party' creates doubt on whether this limitation of liability applies to Lucent and mPhase at all. The definition refers to organizations.
